version 0.1 release.

- - - Updated - - -

So I have finally got around to rebuilding this for KSP0.90. I have added a simple UI that has button to move the CoM target around manually. You can also rename balancers if you have more than one. I now need a few ideas and suggestions as to which direction to go with this mod. I would like to:

1) be able to save multiple CoM target locations.

2) rework the actual balancing code to prioritise maintaining balance along a particular axis.

Any other suggestions?

Great job!

PWB - it is my initials.

Thanks for the mod - I've downloaded and will give this a try.

One note - the OP has the license as CC BY but KerbalStuff lists it as GPLv3.

I'm impressed. This mod helped my vtol spaceplane immensely to achieve stable flight at all times.

But, i had to constantly press my hotkey to rebalance the fuel to the set CoM. Is there a way to continually balance the fuel automatically, without me always mashing my action group hotkey?

Edit: Theres a major problem with this mod in that it somehow breaks launch clamps so that they aren't the immovable objects they normally are, plus it spams the output log with this:

popupActive: False

(Filename: C:/BuildAgent/work/d63dfc6385190b60/artifacts/StandalonePlayerGenerated/UnityEngineDebug.cpp Line: 49)

I just tested without this mod and things are working as they should, so, it's this mod.

Edit: Turns out that the thing with the clamps was some wierdness with KSP plus kraken. This mod was definetly the source of the strange message since that stopped when I removed PWB fuel balancer.

There was also some offbalance listing going on which PWB balancer seemed to valiantly try to fix, but wasn't casued by the plugin, just something I did. Which should be fixed now, had something to do with the side tanks, no idea what.

It seems that 1.0.2 game version has STOCK fuel balancer. At least for SPH-built spaceplanes. Fuel is drained at CoM so fuel-empty CoM is quite near fuel-full CoM if you put tanks both in front and in back of payload.

It's not a stock fuel balancer. Some engines have been recoded to draw fuel uniformly similar to RCS draw. This reduces issues, but does not solve them as you can still wind up shifting your CoM, especially if you drop a stage.
Or if you load/unload cargo during a mission. The inflight COM ball is a must have, should be in stock!
I'd sure like to see this updated for 1.04, and added to CKAN. I'll post in the CKAn thread as well.
This still has uses, despite the 1.0.4 fuel drain. Please update.
